data.title: Entertainment is very very good, not so much for the food
data.text:
Ive been to this restaurant several times over the last 3 years to see the Southland Band which is quite the treat.  Have tried their Ribeye meal, a couple of mexican dishes and just this past weekend tried the buffalo wings and meatballs and who would have thought that these two dishes could be screwed up. 

Well they were, took one bit of a wing and gagged.  The guy that cooks here really needs help to understand how to put a meal together that actually tastes good.

Will continue to visit for the music but I am done with the food

data.title: Good homestyle eats!
data.text: I really enjoyed Main St. because of the live entertainment. They had Motown night it was awesome! Friday night featured artist and homestyle Mexican food great!

data.title: Blue Grass music every Thursday
data.text: Don't expect much from the Mexican or Italian food, but come on Thursday evenings & bring your instrument if you have one.  The Blue Grass & Country music makers will make your day.

data.title: Odd mix of Mexican & Italian dishes
data.text:
This place has been in Yorba Linda just about forever.  They have a large patio which is great when the weather is nice.

There is a mix of Mexican and Italian dishes on the menu.  I have tried several different Mexican plates and have not been overly impressed with any of them.

I tried their pizza recently though and was pleasantly surprised.  It was actually one of the better pies I have tasted in a long time!

Great place to take the family, as there is sure to be something on the menu for everyone.

data.title: Disappointing.
data.text: Awful food. Dirty and dingy. I think maybe there menu is too big? We tried it a couple times and will not be back. It's too bad it's not good. We live so close and would love to be able to walk to downtown YL and have dinner.

data.title: Very American
data.text: Traditional American food at its finest...nothing fancy.  Service is a little slow and understaffed, but it's more like a glorified Denny's.  If you love homemade American food, this is the place.

data.title: Nice find in small (so-called) downtown Yorba Linda
data.text:
We've lived in Yorba Linda now for about 11 years. Since the downtown area is maybe a block long and really doesn't have the type of storefronts we go to I never even knew of the Main Street Restaurant. But saw it the other day and decided to try on Sunday morning for breakfast. 

The restaurant is located on Main Street (gee, you think?) just far enough off Imperial Highway to not be noticed. We parked just down the street and walked to the front door. When we walked in my first impression was we were in the wrong spot. You walk into what looks like a small bar with a few tables around it. But then noticed a small dining room to the left which was a bit cooler than the immediate bar area. This was nice as the outside temp was already close to 90 on it's way to 106. We were greeted after a minute or two and pointed to the dining room without menus. The dining room was sparsely filled with two gentlemen at one table and a family of five at another. We sat at one of the four remaining tables. After about a five minute wait the menus appeared. As I looked it over I was glad to see it wasn't one of those that has 500 items on it. One page with mostly traditional breakfast items. There were also about five "authentic" Mexican breakfast items. 

Our server wandered over and asked if we had any questions while recommending the Eggs Benedict and the egg skillet choices. I asked about the Tex-Mex Omelet and he was honest enough to say he had never tried it. So I went with the Eggs Benedict and my wife the Pancake Sandwich with bacon. The food took about 15 minutes to arrive which is fine as I know it's being made to order. Without a doubt the Eggs Benedict was awesome. Seriously there are so many ways to screw up this dish (eggs poached too long, runny Hollandaise sauce, tasteless ham/Canadian bacon). Yet this came to me perfectly. The dish comes with home style breakfast potatoes which were also pretty darn good. My wife's breakfast was good but not great, typical pancakes and eggs. The syrup comes separately heated up in a small bowl which is a nice touch. The size of the meals are pretty substantial as well.

Overall I think we may have found a hidden breakfast treasure. It's a small place but appears to also have an outside patio although how you get there I have no clue. But the service was attentive and pleasant, the food overall very good, and the cost reasonable. Our two meals ended up about $20 (not counting tip). It's safe to say we'll be back, maybe to try lunch or dinner. Highly recommended.

data.title: No more chances.  :(
data.text:
I can honestly say I try giving this place a chance to convince me their food is worth it. The location is the best with the surrounding mom and pop stores. 
But after trying the place 4 times during the past 3 years, I have to conclude this place has horrible food. And the service to go with it.
